{ 2, 3 }

The start index that you want to pick from.
member.remarks: For example, the pointer is the address of the first element in an array { 0, 1, 3, 6, 10 }, if parameter is 2, the return array will be { 3, 6, 10 }. Note that the parameter should keep the value 5 because the array contains 5 elements in this case.

member.name: M:System.Extensions.StringEx.Reserve(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Reserve all characters that satisfy the specified pattern.
member.param:
The pattern that reserved characters satisfied. All supported patterns are:
@"\d" To match a digit.
@"\t" To match a tab.
@"\w" To match a letter, digit or underscore character '_'.
member.remarks: For example, if code is "Hello, world!".Reserve(@"\w"), the return value won't contain any punctuation marks (i.e. "Helloworld").
member.exception: Throws when the is invalid (Please expand the description of the parameter to learn about all valid patterns).

member.summary: To check if the current string value is a valid regular expression pattern or not.

member.name: T:System.ICloneable`1
member.typeparam: The type of this instance. This type should be only a class because the cloning operation is needed only in reference types, while the value types will be passed by value, at this time all value members (fields and properties) will be copied one by one.
member.remarks: Different with , the cloneation has the same type with this existing instance.

member.name: T:System.IValueComparable`1
member.typeparam: The type of objects to compare. Here it should be a .

member.name: M:System.IValueComparable`1.CompareTo(`0@)
member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type and returns an integer that indicates whether the current instance precedes, follows, or occurs in the same position in the sort order as the other object.
member.param: ( parameter) An object to compare with this instance.
member.returns: A value that indicates the relative order of the objects being compared. The return value has these meanings: Value Meaning Less than zero This instance precedes other in the sort order. Zero This instance occurs in the same position in the sort order as other. Greater than zero This instance follows other in the sort order.

Use the keyword before object creation expression.
Use the instance of this type after called this method.
